content.rendered:
I started something different about a week ago. I was listening to “Atomic Habits” by James Clear and decided that I wanted to work on some of my own habits.

On an index card, I wrote down a list of things that I would like to start doing on a daily basis. I keep it where I can easily see it. On a dry erase board, I have the word “Habits” written. Each time I do one of the things on my list, I put a small box. I had thought about using candies, moving them from one container to another whenever I did something on my list, but this seemed counterproductive. It’s sort of like given myself a gold star.

I have to admit that I had hoped that this system would work for a couple of habits that I would like to break. Sadly, it hasn’t.

According to Clear, it’s a good idea to start small. It’s better to take one step, workout for three minutes, or floss one tooth until it becomes a daily routine. My list includes push-ups (I do three of them), walking ten minutes a day — weather permitting — and writing in my journal. I have drawing on my list, but stopped that habit after a couple of days.

You might like to try something similar. Or, maybe you have your own system. If so, I’d love to hear about it.
